Reviews.Title: “Faultless !”
Reviews.Author: percynorthants
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have said it all, but to emphasise that this lovely hotel is 'designed' from top to bottom : from the landing wall coverings to the bedroom's coordinated colours : and a breakfast room decor that sets of a lovely, extensive cold buffet (but hot is limited if that's what you have to have). Service friendly and efficient : location ideal (especially if you like using the buses to get around) : yet quiet (minimum disruption room to room) We would definitely return if/when Paris lures again.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of perfection in Paris near L'Arc de Triomphe!”
Reviews.Author: KRRI
Reviews.Content: We sooooo enjoyed our stay at Francois 1er in October! It is a lovely, small, charming, neighborhood, quiet hotel situated on a tiny side street near the Champs Elysee. The staff were delightful, the rooms charming, the bathrooms - oh soooo fabulous, the breakfast - even more oh sooooo fabulous! It is well situated for a quick hop onto the Metro or walk across the Seine and surrounded by many wonderful, small restaurants. We will stay here again and again and again! THANK YOU!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely chic boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Aquachic18
Reviews.Content: Before writing this I checked out other reviews on TA and was surprised to read that a recent reviewer was supposed to stay at the Keppler but it was overbooked and so they were accommodated at the Francois - we had also made a reservation at the Keppler (through e-bookers) but when we arrived we were told they had no record of our booking! Not good and I would recommend that anyone booking the Keppler phones them to double check the reservation in advance. However, the staff at the Keppler were reasonably apologetic and offered us a superior room at the Francois including breakfast and a bottle of champagne by way of compensation. Not having seen the rooms in the Keppler, or a standard room in the Francoise we didn't have anything to compare our room to. It was spacious enough, bathroom on the small side though with a sliding door (don't like them!). Huge bed with luxuriously soft linen and pillows. Toiletries were nice and plentiful. There is minibar but no tea/coffee facility. We were on the first floor but the room was v quiet and peaceful overlooking a small enclosed 'garden'. Breakfast was American style buffet and the staff were very courteous. The location is great just off the Champs Elysee, nearest Metro station George V.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AnjaniLondon
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing boutique hotel right in the heart of Paris. It's a minutes walk from the best shopping streets and within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, Louvre and Arc de Triomphe. The service is exceptional and without fault and the rooms are luxurious. It feels like a home away from home. The breakfast is lovely and there is a good selection. My only suggestion for the hotel would be that if we stayed longer it would have been nice to have a choice of hot breakfast. If we went to Paris again we would definately stay here!!! Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at Francois 1er, top place !”
Reviews.Author: yocrodo
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Francois 1er, it is a beautiful hotel perfectly located near the metro George V in a quite area although close to the Champs Elysee. It felt like a B&B deluxe, we really felt very welcome and treated like special guests, not just clients in a hotel. Our double room was not too big but the rooms are beautifully decorated and the bed so comfortable - great pillows and perfect mattress. Very clean bathroom with nice big bath. Lovely attention in the evening by the bed -bottles of water and chocolates. We also found the rooms very warm but once we switched off the heating it was fine. The hotel is quiet at night, we slept so well. Breakfast was fine but pricey. At checkout thought, to our surprise the manager very kindly offered a lower rate to all of us (we were 3 couples) on the breakfast, as well as he gave a special price to one of the couples who had a more expensive room than the rest (when booking it was the only one available) so that we all pay the same price. Very attentive of him, and very appreciated by the 6 of us ! The rest of the staff was as attentive, friendly and welcoming as the manager. Hotel might be on the expensive side but well worth the money for the comfort and professionalism of its staff. To be recommended ! One of our best experience in the hotel world !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekender boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baso77
Reviews.Content: Paris had been our last stop for our Christmas/new year european honeymoon. We were to stay in Paris from dec 29th till jan 3rd. We had chosen Francios 1er based on trip advisor's recommendations and I must say, it is a very good hotel if you are staying one or two nights. Location is very ideal if you are looking for champs élysées touristic scene. However, for long stays I would look at the many parisian hotel. Check in was extremely smooth and the manager, which we saw the first day and last day (every one need a holiday break sometime) was extremely welcoming. On the last day we had breakfast on the house, wonderfully made. We had the deluxe room and it was a bit small, it had a two twin bed attached to each other to feel like king bed. One day I had felt sick and stayed in. Would have liked to get room service, unfortunately the hotel lacks this service. In short we would come back if staying a maximum of two days, but would rather have a full service hotel on longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PickyaboutHotels
Reviews.Content: I generally like large hotels with modern decor. The Hotel Francois was small, "boutiquey" and traditional, and, in spite of this, I liked it very much. Our suite was equipped with 5 star quality furnishings... luxurious draperies, ultra-high quality furniture, exquisite wall coverings and a very comfortable king bed. ( real king bed; not 2 twins put together) The bathroom was large, had marble flooring, walls and sink tops. It had both a large bathtub and separate stall shower. The reception staff were ultra friendly and helpful. Breakfast offerings were plentiful and top quality. (the only thing missing was bacon) Service was cheerful and efficient. The location was great with the Eiffel Tower, Arch d Triumph and Champs Elysses within short walks. The temperature in our room tended to be uncomfortably warm. This was mitigated by turning off the heat and opening the windows. This worked well as the hotel is located on a quiet street. While the location is terrific in may respects, it is quite far from Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter and Monmartre. A couple we met at breakfast complained about the the ultra small size of their standard room. Those considering staying here might consider this when selecting a room category. This is my 30th Trip Advisor review and I consider the Francois to be in the top five of all the hotels I have reviewed. I found the other TA reviews of the Francois 1er to be unusually accurate. The management of this hotel clearly knows how to run an excellent facility. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: riitta i
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Francois 1er hotel for our Christmas shopping. We warmly recommend this hotel. From the beginning we were well taken care of. The room was good size and we loved the decoration. The whole hotel was very beautiful. Everyone in the staff was kind and professional. We were also pleasantly surpriced with the buffet breakfast. We have never had that much choise in other Paris hotels. We definetely recommend this hotel and we will stay there during our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing at the End”
Reviews.Author: Alexis_Meni
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris and the specific hotel in Nov. 2011. In general the hotel was ok and the pricing could say acceptable if you consider its Paris. Don't expect anything fancy etc, it’s just a regular hotel located in a quiet street (the back rooms not recommended as the very dark and depressing). The area where the breakfast is served is in the basement and very dark again, I would not recommend b’fast at this hotel (but note nothing located near by serving anything better). We had a small problem with our lock but the hotel gave us a regular key instead of a card key so nothing bad abt that… The room was acceptable and size ok for a w/e stay. Over all it was clean and the bathroom as well. We would have chosen this hotel again in the future (although we like to try others as well) if it wasent for the last minute rip off! On the day of our departure we asked from the front desk to arrange a taxi for the airport. When we walked out the door there was no regular taxi waiting but your privet ride. I specifically told the front desk that I want a regular taxi as I don't want to pay extra for private car etc. Hotel front desk assured me that the cost would be the same as a regular taxi. (For your guidance when we arrived we took from the airport a taxi that charged us 35€ with the meter running plus some extra € for the luggage and I give the taxi 40€). When we arrived to the airport the private ride driver requested from me 68€ !!! and please note that their was ZERO traffic on our way to the airport. So I then told the driver my arrival fair...and he was shocked. To cut a long story short I paid 50€ to driver and he left angry without even saying thank you etc. I was misled and mistreated by the hotel personnel and that is unacceptable. This line out my frustration and off course I don't plan to visti this hotel ever again. It's not a mater about 20/30€ its about being straight. For a closing I would also like to share with you that I sent the hotel the above story as a complaint, first they told me: QUOTE Dear Mr, After checking all our data mail, we have never received your email or request for assistance. Would you mind tell us to which email address you have sent your request? Kind regards, Soufiane Ghezouti Revenue Manager UNQUOTE I sent the same text again, and still after almost 2 months I have received not reply. That's all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Would definitely recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lozza_2012
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a long weekend in Paris. We were originally booked into this hotel for 2 nights, 9th and 10th Dec, when we got there they explained that the hotel had been double booked and they had put us up in another 4* hotel a 5 minute walk away. The gentleman at the front desk, could not have been more helpful!!! He arranged a taxi for us and told us to get a receipt and he would refund the cost when we checked back in tomorrow. As a good will gesture he said he would give us a room upgrade, a bottle of Champagne and free breakfast on saturday and sunday morning. When we came back on saturday morning, he had our room waiting and had refunded our taxi costs from the previous day. We was looking for a good restaurant for the saturday night, he had recommended Chef Francis (8-10min walk) and was able to get us a 9pm reservation, something the other hotel wasn't able to do. We went to the room and it was lovely, spacious and clean most hotels in Paris I have found to be Boutique and not big burly hotels. When returning from our sightseeing we returned to find a bottle of Champagne in our room waiting for us :-) The food at Chef Francis was lovely!!! It isn't cheap but then it's not going to be because of its location. 2 mains, 2 desserts, bottle of wine and 2 bottles of water was roughly £130. The breakfast the following morning had plenty of choice, from cheeses, hams, cereals, cooked breakfast croissants etc etc The location of this hotel was perfect, a 2 min walk and you were on the Champs Elysee Avenue and could see the Arc De Triomphe and a 15-20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris. They could not do enough for us and were so helpful with reservations, directions and places of interest. It made our stay a lot more relaxed and enjoyable. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Oh yes...........yes,yes,yes”
Reviews.Author: Burcottbabe
Reviews.Content: Everything previous reviews have said is true, but there are a couple of things that you may find useful. 1. Breakfast is served until 11am. :-) 2. Wifi is free. :-) 3. There is no hospitality tray to make a hot drink. :-(

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jgorski630
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the most romantic quintessential Parisian hotel for your next trip this is the place. The staff goes above and beyond for anything you need at the hotel. The service is absolutely amazing, the food is divine and the ambiance and decor is stunning and inviting all at the same time. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to have the most Parisian get away they can!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stylish hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PeterCbrussels
Reviews.Content: I can recommend the hotel, very nicely decorated and comfortable. The breakfast although extra was excellent and served until 11 am. The only critism is that the wardrobe space was way too small. A few coat hooks behind the door would be a big help. The location is hard to beat, one block from the metro and the champs élysées. Also it's a short walk from the lido, just 5 minutes. Not cheap, but on balance worth it I my view.

Reviews.Title: “'Stunning Little Gem '”
Reviews.Author: emma_1973
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic little hotel.Really stylish ,wonderful decor and very helpful and friendly staff. We stayed here for four days in a standard room,which had a lovely comfy bed ,mini bar marble bathroom with robes and slippers.Everyday our room was made up with fresh towels and linen.A nice touch was the chocolates and weather report in the room each night ready for the next day.Free wi.fi access for the duration too. The breakfast wa buffet style with cold meats ,cheese,fruit,yoghurts etc plus the added bonus of sausages toms and scrambled eggs!! All lovely topped of with a huge basket of french pastries on each table !!! So nice !!! Really have nothing to bad to say about this hotel.....except maybe the location being only a stones throw from the Champs Elysees,means its very easy to spend far too money !! Would reccommend to all ... a four star hotel with a five star experience !"

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: julieta m
Reviews.Content: It was great! Perfect service and treatment! Next time in Paris, will stay at the same hotel! Congratulations for the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cici X
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online at about £80 per night for he room, paid a bit extra for upgrade as well. Compared price on a few sites, turnout one site (lastminute.com I think) had a bargain. It is about 10 mins walk to Avenue des Champs-Élysées (very good with shopping and restaurants). The hotel is quiet, pretty, clean, especially a classic room design. I also loved the breakfast area and the breakfast (very nice pastries) and polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Tops for location”
Reviews.Author: Wennie_T
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we found the location of this hotel to be brilliant. It is pretty much 1 min from the Champs Elysees, 5 mins to the Arc de Triomphe, approx 15 mins to the Concorde and from there just another 5-10 mins through the garden to the Lourve. We stayed in an executive room which was massive by European standards. The room faced the street but it was very quiet and we slept peacefully every night. Furnishings were lovely - gives a lovely French feel while remaining tasteful. Staff were friendly and helpful especially at the breakfast room. The breakfast buffet provides a good variety of cereals/cold meats/fruits/cheese and even individually packaged snack bars for you to pack away in your bag for later in the day. The hotel has only one lift which fits about 4 people. It can be slow sometimes but there are stairs which is a decent option given that there are just 5/6 floors. There is also a computer with internet access on the ground floor with a printer - really handy for non tech savvy people like us who don't travel with net gadgets :) Chocs and temperature for the next day every night are a really nice tough too. Would definitely recommend the Hotel Francois 1er to anyone as we would definitely come back ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Francois 1er paris”
Reviews.Author: Trip-Food-Wine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent recently many days in this small, classy hotel, when my flat in Paris had been renovated. It is not easy to find a good hotel that is at the same time recently renovated (by a famous architect) and with a reasonable prise, compared to other hotels in this top area of Paris. Really caring staff, particularly at the front desk. The rooms are cosy and well equiped.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect place to stay for a trip to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: benjamin_u
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here last weekend (September 24th and 25th) whilst on a short break in Paris. I often have reservations about 'smaller' hotels but this one was absolutely wonderful! When we arrived, a very welcoming gentleman greeted us and took our bags in. We had not told the hotel that we would be arriving 5 hours before the standard check in time however, it was as if they were expecting us anyway! The check in process was incredibly smooth and quick and the manager made us feel at home immediately. Perfect service. Our bags were taken upstairs for us (in the elevator by the stairs hidden by a fake bookcase!) and we were so impressed by the room. You could tell that the hotel/room had been re-decorated recently and that the hotel care about preserving the fixtures and fittings in the room. It was also spotlessly clean. The room was a decent size and very typically French - just what we wanted. The bed was very comfortable - almost too comfortable because we didn't want to get out!The bathroom had a good shower, was of ample size and again, very clean. One other thing to note - the room was cleaned and fresh towels were provided twice a day. The location of this hotel could not be more perfect. It is on a quiet, safe and clean street. The Champs Elysee and Arc de Triomphe is a 30 second walk and you can reach the Eifel Tower on foot in 10-15 minutes (depending on how fast you walk!). One of the Les Rouges bus tour stops can also be found within a 2 minute walk of the hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel so I couldn't comment on the quality but by reading other reviews and judging by the rest of the hotel, I would assume it is very good! All in all, this hotel represented excellent value for money and I definitely recommend this to Trip Advisor members. Whether on a short break or if I was in Paris for a week, i would stay at Hotel Francois 1er every single time. We look forward to going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place For Our Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: 52marv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. I selected this hotel because it was close to the Champs Elysee, the L'Arc de Triomphe and transportation (literally a 5 minute stroll from the hotel). Hotel Francois 1er was the perfect spot for us. The L'OpenTour hop on hop off buses have a stop around the corner and down the street from the hotel, almost next to the George V metro stop. There is wonderful shopping and people watching nearby and plenty of bistros including Fouquet's. You can walk all the way down the Champs Elysee to the Place de la Concorde and on to the Tuileries Gardens. The hotel itself is on a quiet side street which was very peaceful. Beside the excellent location, the staff was fantatsic, warm, friendly and willing to go out of their way to make your stay excellent. As others have said, the breakfast is wonderful and really a great way to start the day. The rooms are small, but lovely and comfortable. The room pictures on this site are very accurate. We had a lovely time at this hotel and recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act in the City of Lights.”
Reviews.Author: 10814BRNS
Reviews.Content: What can I say that has not already been written about this lovely Parisian Boutique Hotel.Stayed for a week in July,occupied a suite and a regular bedroom on the first floor.Both accomodations were wonderful,obviously one was larger than the other but the degree of finishing and detail in both was identical.Greatly appreciated as we instantly felt like we were at home.Very tasteful and very smart.Well done.The latter relates to Value which for this property in this location can't be beat.Paris I dont expect is ever much of a bargain so you just have to do the best you can.Service was very good,typical of a well run 4 star hotel.Breakfast,mostly had in the room and Anne saw to it that delivery never took much longer than 5 minutes.Again well done.House keeping was very good and the only complaint might that the light decor items in the suite in particular might need to be shampooed or replaced,not an issue concerning the maids.Reception, Stephanie is a gem,a true professional.And thankyou for all of your kind assistance and personal attention,Greatly appreciated.Definately would recommend to any and all.Looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem”
Reviews.Author: Guvan
Reviews.Content: After 18 trips to Paris, I finally found this little gem.This discrete hotel has a superb location: right in the middle of the Champs Elysees, next to the undergroundstation George V and right behind the Louis Vuittonshop. The beautifully decorated room we had had was rather small but had everything one needs: a great bed, a fine bathroom etc... The little details such as a free glass of champagne as a welcomedrink, a free bottle of water in the evening, a chocolate and the weather forecast on your pillow, even an umbrella in the wardrobe in case it might rain made you feel very at home. The breakfast buffet in the morning was one of the best I ever had in Paris. The staff was very friendly and tried everything to make your stay agreeable. If I go to Paris again (and I surely will) I will defenitely go to the Francois Ier again!

Reviews.Title: “superb for our wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: lukkiya
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights while visitting Paris, hotel is just of champs elysees so within 4 min walk we were right on the main road also its about 20 min walk to eiffel tower. we loved the service its just so proffesional and nothing was a problem, rooms are small but clean and very comfy. great from the minute we check in to the minute we check out and we left our laguages on the day we check out for about 7 hours for free. superb breakfast thank u for hospitality

Reviews.Title: “You'd be fortunate to call this home”
Reviews.Author: AlecWalker
Reviews.Content: Beautifully turned-out boutique hotel, with service that is both personal and nonintrusive. The gentlemen at the front desk were genial and correct, and always seemed to recognize me, even if we had not met. Guests made a point to say good-bye to the waitstaff at breakfast the day that they were leaving and the staff in turn wished them safe travels and a speedy return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: kathy_a_morales
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a year ago while vacationing in Paris. It's very close to the train, beautiful, quiet, clean and the service we got was excellent. I'd highly recoomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Buzzy43
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a street about 2 minutes from the George V subway stop and a 5 minute walk to the Arc. For those who care, a Starbucks is located on the Champs in an arcade of shops also 5 minutes away on foot. The hotel is beautifully appointed and extremely clean. The staff is very professional and we found them very accommodating and friendly. The buffet breakfast we had was at a discounted rate of 13 Euro we obtained through the site we booked on - not inexpensive as there are 7 in my family but we were able to have a hearty breakfast that fueled our long walks into mid afternoon. The room were furnished in a lovely manner and the bed linens were great. The TV received CNBC and Bloomberg if that is important to you. Wifi was free and that is great as our hotel in Heidelberg wanted 15 Euro a day. It was a great trip

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: londoner-reviews
Reviews.Content: Right in the center of Paris, perfect for sightseeing and good restaurants. This hotel is truly a hidden gem and fantastic value for money! Possibly the only minor complaint is that breakfast is very expensive - I would recommend finding a cafe somewhere nearby for half the price and more options. We will definitely be coming back though.

Reviews.Title: “Very Great”
Reviews.Author: Daniel B
Reviews.Content: Great place , in the middle of the action Great service and very confortable

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: syouatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 8th Anniversary and first trip to Paris. It was a beautiful hotel, the rooms were very nicely decorated and alot of little extras added. The staff all spoke excellent english and very tolerant to those of us that do not know any french. The hotel is less than a 5 minute walk to the arc de triumph and a main metro station (very important if you are disabled). The breakfast room was beautifuly decorated and very well setup. There was a large selection for you to choose from and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A very charming and french experience.”
Reviews.Author: bestvacation_11
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Paris and I really loved the whole city and was glad we stayed at this hotel. It is in the 8th arr. The hotel is very french with the decor and curtains and bed spread but it's also clean. The staff is very accomodating and helpful. Also it is at a great location being walking distance to all of the best shopping. We also walked to Arc de Triomph and the Eiffell tower. And their breakfast is just Awesome! I am still thinking about the bread basket with chocolate croissants. Looking forward to coming back here and would love to stay here again. Only drawback was that there was only 1 elevator and it is quite small. The day we were leaving for the airport we had to keep waiting for an empty elevator so all our bags could fit with us. And this was early in the morning. That took some time and we were getting worried. Other times it was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Superior hotel-perfect location”
Reviews.Author: buzzzzsaw
Reviews.Content: Hotel Francois 1er completed exceeded our expectations and made our Paris visit extra special in every way. We had read about so many sketchy experiences with tiny rooms, broken plumbing and noisy locations that we were a bit weary, fearful of what lie waiting upon our arrival. Hotel Francois 1er was absolutely stunning- beautifully appointed, first class in every aspect, exceptional hotel staff and wonderful accommodations. And the location- oh my goodness- one block off the Champs Elysee where the shopping and dining options are endless! The Concierge was so helpful directing us to key parts of Paris - we were non-French speaking guests - that we felt completely comfortable negotiating our way around. We would recommend Hotel Francois 1er 100% and hope to return someday!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: ghazama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for 3 nights however upon arrival, we were told that there was no room available the first night. Instead they had booked a room at a sister hotel just 3 minutes walk away. I admit I was a bit annoyed with this inconvenience but the staff was very apologetic and upgraded our first night to a suite + included a complimentary bottle of champagne. They also arranged the transfer of our luggage so we didn´t have to worry about lugging our stuff around. We then stayed at the Francois 1er the following nights in the Classic room. We had already expected the room to be small but it was very nicely decorated and the bed was comfortable. I loved that the bathroom had a tub. Perfect to soak in and relax after a whole day of walking and sight seeing. Location was central and just minutes walk to Champs Elysees & George V metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Leisure; Seems Ideal for Business”
Reviews.Author: BDRoyal
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Francois. We arrived after 10 pm and there were no problems with checking in. Our room was small, but not uncomfortably so. While the hotel is only two blocks from the Champs-Elysses, it was remarkably quiet at night and not overrun with cars or tourists. Very convenient to the Metro, which allowed us to reach far-flung locations very quickly. The only complaint is that we shared a wall with the bathroom of the neighboring room, so we knew exactly when they were using the shower....luckily, it was not much of an issue.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BritaParis
Reviews.Content: Just don't hesitate to book if you want to live central but quiet. Just 100 - 200 m to Champs Elysées and l'arc de triomphe. And easy to go with the metro to the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel With Excellent Location!!”
Reviews.Author: TerriDougherty
Reviews.Content: This little boutque hotel is absolutely wonderful! The staff is kind and friendly, they booked a tour for us and let us check out late at no additional charge. The location I can't say enough good things about. Close to The Arc De Triomphe, 2 blocks away from The Champs Eyllesses, and a short walk to the most beautiful view of The Eiffel Tower! The rooms were decorated in country french style and breakfast was provided every morning at 6:30am to 10:00 am. The breakfast was the best we had at any of our hotels and we went to London, Paris and Rome. This hotel was by far our favorite of all 3 cities. I highly recommend this little beautiful hotel to anyone who is planning a trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is AMAZING do not hesitate to book this little gem”
Reviews.Author: dippydawn1975
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this beautiful hotel exceeded expectations on every level. The rooms were exceptional clean and well cared for, the staff were soooooo helpful, please book the dine and cruise it was a brilliant experience, such attention to detail, food lovely and was wonderful to see paris at nite. I always base my hotel booking on trip advisor reports and could not find anything negative so booked and was not let down. Am now recomending this hotel to all my friend, whilst we were there Boy George was also a guest.........even stars prefer this hotel. WONDERFUL WONDERFUL WONDERFULWe were celebrating my daughters 30th birthday this was one she will never forget, full of very happy memories.......we love paris and the Francois 1er thank you for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Super stylish, affordable, & comfortable rooms in the heart of Champs”
Reviews.Author: Oztin79
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'd definitely return to the F1er when I'm next in Paris unless I want to be in a different part of town (Champs Elysee's slightly uppity, but mostly enjoyable). The location in the heart of Champs can't be beat (the Four Seasons chose it too); if you like walking, a terrific up-close view of the Eiffel is accessible for a romantic evening stroll). The rooms are comfortable and stylish and the staff was generally responsive and friendly. Metro stop Georges V is only a 4-minute walk. The only complaint is that when it was time to settle the bill, we were overcharged for one night and waaaay overcharged for the daily (and very good) American buffet breakfast (22 EUR/plate!). Fortunately, my lady's a Swiss banker and saw the discrepancy immediately :) We didn't even have to ask before they reduced the breakfast charge to 12 EUR each. That's it! Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Radwell_JN
Reviews.Content: Located just off the Champs Elysee, this hotel is a perfect location and very quite. Every thing about the hotel makes you feel comfortable, the rooms, the service, excellent buffet breakfast in the basement. Drinks are expensive but they all are in this part of Paris. We dined at Oscars (1km away) and were disappointed, on the second night we dined at Relais de Venis which was an excellent experience! and finally on the last night we dined at Relais de L'Isle on the St Louis en L'Isle island; this again was very good. All in all an excellent holiday, made perfect by the hotel staff. P.S. The receptionist even bet me a bottle of champagne that France would beat England at rugby; England WON! and we enjoyed the champagne.

Reviews.Title: “up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: littlecheese
Reviews.Content: Helpful and efficient staff make this good hotel an excellent place to stay. It is close to the main tourist attractions, metro George V near by, attractive decor, comfortable beds, beautifully clean and quiet. Evening meals can be supplied/brought in by a good local restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Outstandingly good ... a gem !”
Reviews.Author: jacqui301192
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend to celebrate my husband's birthday and were truly delighted with the Hotel. Having arrived at 11.00am we checked into the hotel, although we didn't expect the room to be ready. The staff asked us to return in about an hour so we left our luggage and went off to the Champs Elysee for some breakfast. On our return the staff advised us that we had been upgraded to a superior room - which lived up to its name. The bed was the best we had ever slept in, the decor was elegant. The breakfast room was bright and stylish, with a good choice of food. We didn't feel that this was a small breakfast room as other comments (we have stayed in Paris on several occasions and had breakfast in much smaller rooms). The staff were always efficient and polite - nothing was too much trouble. The Hotel is situated just off the Champs Elysee in a quiet side road and in a good location for the Metro. We loved this hotel, would recommend this without hesitation (although we would also like to keep this gem to ourselves) - we will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Their is no better at this Price”
Reviews.Author: WillemSpike
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Paris on regular business trips for the past ten years. I generally seek out boutique hotels and after this staay will now settle on Francois Premier in the future. The fit and finish of the hotel surpasses even the big hotels the service and ambiance are that of a private residence with full staff. The location can not be better as you are less than 2 min to either georges V, champs elysees and arc de trihomphe. I will certainly be returining with my wife this time who will thrilled as I will to return. No problems with e mail, it was also included (which can be expensive in europe) with the hotel rate and also recommend the buffet option as running our for a coffee can cost as much as ten dollars nearby. A great deal fantastic experience, well done and dont hesitate to book.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location is 5 mins fr.om Arc de Triomphe and the Metro. Staff pleasant and helpful Free WiFi, great breakfast, rooms small but comfortable and par for the course in Paris. Recommended. Also it's 5 mins from The Lido Cabaret - truly it's gobsmAckingly good and one of the 100 things to see before you die - food is what you would expect at a cabaret like this. SEE THIS SHOW! You will not regret it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: kopita
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Francois 1er truly deserves this descriptive title. Our family (11 people, including 3 children) stayed at the hotel for two weeks during the Christmas/New Years holiday. This hotel is one of the 'gems´ in the Champs-Elysees area. Luxuriously designed, the guest rooms are comfortable, spacious (for Paris) and very quiet. The ground floor has two 'living rooms' where we enjoyed our family time together, having hot chocolates and teas. The abundant breakfast - offering fresh breads, fruits, yogurts, cheese and charcuterie - closed at 11 am, perfect for us, the late-risers. Housekeeping too did a terrific and thorough job. The best part, however, was the service staff who were ALL genuinely kind and helpful in accommodating our special needs ... from finding restaurants to giving us event information to simply, receiving packages for us. The only negative was the absence of a restaurant and/or a bar serving snacks. To address this negative however, the hotel has developed partnerships with two local restaurants who are able deliver meals until late in the evening. Hotel Francois 1er is an excellent choice and we highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “not good but great!”
Reviews.Author: pigeonsisniceTWO
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here weekend 11th-13th December.Check in was seamless and efficient which was appreciated at around 9pm ish. Room was lovely with a small dressing area just off the bathroom.Location is superb 2mins and 22 secs from being able to clearly take a photo of the arc du triomphe(yesI timed it!) Breakfast was lovely and very laid back,we were able to take our time without feeling rushed.There was some hot stuff, lovely sausages and delicious scrambled eggs etc .There was also some cold meats and hams,smoked salmon and cream cheese.Add to this a delicious range of breads and pastries on each table and for me , you've got a delicious breakfast. Staff were brilliant especially Thomas who was very knowledgable about everything local,he also went above and beyond the call of duty by booking us a table at Oscars for Saturday dinner. This hotel is just charming,we loved our time here ,we also loved the little touches like the free Champagne,chocolates on the pillow even an umby in the wardrobe they seem to have thought of everything. One thing that wasnt up to scratch was the housekeeping,we found an item of someone elses clothing under our bed (didnt look too close to see what it was!) and there was also some kind of stain in the bathroom which was there when we arrived but was gone the next day! However even that could not stop us rating this hotel a 5 out of 5 overall because everything else was just perfect. We will definately return and would strongly recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Le chic à Paris”
Reviews.Author: marcogiov
Reviews.Content: Very elegant, trés chic small hotel two minutes away from Champs Elysées and metro station. François 1er is in the best position while it manages to be away from the crowds. It has luxury without the grandeur of the big "palaces", so it seems that you are in your own wonderful residence in the best spot of Paris. Lounges amd rooms are very elegant, chic, that's why tou came to Paris! We had a classic room, not big but comfortable. Unfortunately there was no way to manage the excessive heating. They give us a huge discount on the really good breakfast. Free WiFi in the lobby and lounges.

Reviews.Title: “CHIC BOUTIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: rygsa
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, wonderful service, extremely quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Very French Chic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eurocruise
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay at this hotel and not disappointed. Located just off Champs Elysee in a quiet street this boutique hotel offers homely elegant comfort with personalised service. The rooms although generally small are beautifully furnished many with balconies.The buffet breakfast is real treat. Good selection of hot and cold meats, cheeses and fruit not forgetting the fabulous french bread and croissants. The staff were friendly - nothing was too much trouble and made you feel very comfortable. George V metro is located just around the corner for easy access to the rest of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely central Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: TwoJulz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights over the New Year period and we loved this hotel. The atmosphere is cosy and friendly. The decor is elegant. The rooms are not large but very comfortable and attractive. Breakfast was good. The location is perfect for sightseeing. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rk-winelover17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Paris as part of our honeymoon trip. We were surprised when we arrived and learned that our reservation had been "cancelled" by the company we booked with! Not exactly what you want to hear when youve traveled half around the world. The hotel was very accomodating though, and set us up with a room in their sister hotel for 1 night, and then with them for the remainder of our stay. Their sister hotel was very nice with amazing decor. Our room was tiny, but it was very modern and had an amazing shower. We loved the Francois 1er when we finally got to our room. It was very large and had everything we needed. THe location is excellent and the staff was very helpful. When I lost my cell phone, all the staff came to help me. They also made reservations and arranged cab rides for us. I def. recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: PenneTom
Reviews.Content: Hotel Francois 1er is great boutique hotel. It is very conveniently located (1.5 blocks from the Champs-Élysées). Rooms are a little small but that's to be expected in Europe in general. The hotel was very clean, lots of hot water and the breakfast buffet is very good (and it's not that expensive when you consider it cost me 9 euros for a coffee and a "pain au chocolat" at a bar on the Champs-Élysées). The staff was very friendly and helpful. BTW: If you need a ride back to the airport, don't take a taxi as it can be between 50 and 70 euros. Instead, go up to the Arc de Triomphe and take the Air France "Les Cars" shuttle bus for 15 euros. Runs every 15 minutes during the week and every half hour during the weekend. If there's no traffic, the bus will get you there in under 45 minutes (compliments of hotel manager)

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dbb123
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, boutique hotel with a small, personal feel. Beautifully decorated and only a few minutes' walk off the Champs d'Elysees. Very high-end so you may want to pack your black dress slacks rather than your jeans. Concierges were very helpful, all spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a long romantic weekend in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: HA_SWLondon
Reviews.Content: I read a ton of reviews on Trip Advisor before finally selecting this one through British Airways holidays... It was the first time I was taking my new girlfriend away so I wanted everything to be perfect, and it was! It's an amazing boutique hotel, with a lovely reception area, lovely room and gorgeous breakfast. The location is perfect too and very quiet at night... It's not cheap at £200 ($300) a night but worth every penny... I can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: VitaliyS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this luxury boutique hotel only for two nights - but it was fantastic and unforgettable stay. This trip was dedicated to the 4th anniversary of our wedding, thus I booked the hotel in advance via IPrefer site. One week prior to arrival I sent the e-mail to the hotel explaining them that it will be our anniversary and asked for the possibility of room upgrade and they answered that they will fulfill our request. The situation of hotel is fantastic – on very quiet street away from noise at the same time only 2 minutes by foot from Champs Elysees, and George V metro station. In terms of location you can hardly find anything better. Regarding value – we were lucky to book very special week end offer with 50% discount on the second night including breakfast – thus we paid only 331 Euros for 2 nights which is very low price for the hotel of such caliber in the heart of Paris. Upon arrival we were upgraded to Executive room (2 categories higher than we originally booked), moreover we were shown 2 different rooms of this category and proposed to choose one of them. We preferred room (302) situated on 3rd floor and facing the street with 2 French windows and French balconies. The interior of the room was very romantic (look at the pictures enclosed). The room is not so big, but more than enough for 2 persons: very comfortable queen size bed with pillow menu, carefully selected furniture, combination of precious fabrics and tapestries on the walls, free safe, LCD TV and umbrella in the wardrobe. The bathroom features - bath tube, VRAI luxury amenities and bathrobe and slippers of very good quality. The hotel interiors – both rooms and public zones were tastefully designed in classic style by famous Pierre Yves Rochon- and they are so charming and romantic, that I really don’t have enough words to describe this luxurious and truly Parisian atmosphere! As IPrefer guests we were given the voucher for 2 flutes of champagne which we took in hotel bar with fireplace and winter garden The breakfast is very good, with wide variety and very fresh products in very romantic atmosphere. The hotel is spotless clean and the service is GREAT! All public places are full of different historical things and fresh flowers. During our stay I asked the site staff to show me other types of rooms and would like to say that all of them are quite good the only concern in Classic and Standard rooms is smaller beds which probably would not fit well for the bigger people. All in all I would highly recommend this magnificent hotel for those who want to spend an unforgettable days in the heart of Paris in romantic atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem!”
Reviews.Author: kathyinatlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January and we were upgraded on arrival. Our room, was very nice and comfortable, the staff were friendly and helpful. They gave us directions to restaurants where we had amazing meals...Everyone was so friendly and sweet to us, it was our second stay and we cannot wait to return. It is so centrally located you can walk to the Champs Elysees nd the George V metro is around the corner. We even walked to the Eiffel Tower and then took the metro back. Our rate also included breakfast which we enjoyed each day. Truly a hidden gem in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “As Good as it Gets”
Reviews.Author: nashvillecat37066
Reviews.Content: PERFECT is not a word that I use lightly. In my life I have stayed in close to a thousand hotels and this is the best. Great location, excellent food, comfortable and well furnished room, but it is their People who make the difference. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Soufiane went over and beyond the call of duty, solving a problem that was not related to the Hotel but threatened to spoil our trip. I cannot state enough superlatives to describe this gem of a Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice accomodation, great value, I recommend”
Reviews.Author: Wineteacher
Reviews.Content: I would love to afford to stay at the George V - this hotel is literally 60 seconds away and 1/3 the price. I really enjoyed this hotel. Great service, great breakfast, nice beds, clean, efficient. The George V is a lavish, amazing place, and I stayed there a couple times before - but in these economic times, I need to be more thrifty and staying at Hotel Francois allows for me to spend an addition 500 Euro's a day on food, wine and everything else. Hotel Francois 1er is nice by all standards - don't get me wrong. This is a wonderful place and I may never go back to the ultra luxury icons - when small places like this take great care of the guests. I had a button rip off my jacket - they fixed it. I hung a sign on my door asking for quiet - I got it. The blackout shades allowed for me to sleep an entire day to adjust! Love it - I'm going back soon. What the hotel is not: - a club or other local hangout - no bar - pretentious - large and unorganized Best things: - Location - quiet - just off a major street - easy to find - priced perfectly

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent loction”
Reviews.Author: Leee30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate my wifes birthday in February. The Hotel. Small rooms but nicely appointed. Good Breakfast and friendly for a city hotel. The location. Excellent for the Arc de Triomphe, just a couple of minutes litrally for the Champs-Élysées with lots of restaurants and bars everything you could want from Paris. The food. Well, it's France isn't it so you will struggle to get a bad meal. Couldn't believe how many people were in McDonalds, whats that all about?? go to France and eat in McDonalds I don't think so! We walked everywhere and found some excellent off beat areas, wow was it expensive though or it could have been my wifes taste in clothes. Overall recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: FrequentVisitor
Reviews.Content: Took my husband to Paris for three nights and booked everything using my airmiles. Chose this hotel becuase of the reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. I had booked a standard room, but when we arrived the concierge took one look at my husband (who is 6'2" and 18 stone) and said that we would be far more comfortable in an executive suite, and he upgraded us at no cost. The room was beautifully decorated, as were all the public rooms. The breakfast was fantastic and really set us up for the day. Location was just a two minute walk to Champs Elysee and the metro line, but we walked everywhere. Concierge recommended a restaurant for us on the first night (Chez Andre) and that too was great. We asked them to book our taxi back to the airport as a sheet in our room said that is should cost no more than 49 euros and we had paid 60 for th incoming trip. Taxi was on time and even though we hit traffic, the cost was 48 euros. Didn't recognise the route he took, so can only assume that the taxi driver that took us to the hotel took a detour to earn his fare! Overall, will definately go back to this hotel. Taking my son in a few months to visit the art galleries....and I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Pursew
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and could not fault it. The hotel only has 40 rooms so it doesn't feel impersonal. The hotel is really stylish with a very Parisian interior. Our room was a standard room and was really comfortable and very clean. It is the little things that are great at this hotel, like the little card that they slip under your door in the evening giving you the weather forecast for the next day. As for the hotel's location, it's just of the Champs Elysees, a two minute walk from George V metro station so it's in a great spot. Will definitely return to this hotel, next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of peace but so close to the Champs Elysees”
Reviews.Author: SarahandJames
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in March. It is just off the Champs Elysees but so quiet. We loved it. The rooms are small but well presented and tasteful. The bathroom, again small but perfectly formed! Toiletries etc are as you would expect from a good hotel with bathrobes and slippers provided. The lounge area of the hotel is relaxing and welcoming. The hotel breakfast was better than we expected with a really good range of hot and cold foods. This hotel is perfect for couples. Just a few minutes walk and you are right in the middle of things with The Lido only 5 minutes stroll away.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a central, but quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Tipfromme
Reviews.Content: A charming, small boutique hotel with great staff! The hotel is situated in a very quiet side street (we had executive rooms on high floors, but it seemed very quiet in general), but still close to several attractions and shopping. A perfect choice for a weekend break!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: caseybecks
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay with my wife. Hotel was in a great location just 2 minutes walk from Champs Elysee and George V. Staff all very friendly and room was very classy (though as usual with a capital city, a little bit on the small size). With so many things to do and places to see we had our trip well planned in advance and it helped us to see everything we wanted and more. Would recommend the Museum Pass and buying carnet (10 tickets) for the Metro. Also totally recommend the Velib bikes..... cycling along by the Seine.... fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: TMAY_LOS
Reviews.Content: The rooms were immaculate, tastefully decorated with Parisian flare. The staff was courteous, friendly, and extremely helpful with sightseeing and restaurant suggestions. The hotel is a short 5-minute walk to the Champs Elyesees, George V subway station and another 5-minutes to the Arc de Triumph. I would easily choose this hotel for another vacation to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a great location run by superb staff”
Reviews.Author: BobbyBeake
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good hotel in a central location for my first vist to Paris to celebrate my 50th birthday with my partner and chose this hotel based on the numerous complimentary reviews posted about this hotel by visitors, but also the comments posted by the hotel. We were not disappointed and cannot praise the hotel and staff enough particularly when we became stranded in Paris due to Eurostar breaking down. they were very understanding and helpful throughout and even gave us a lovely suite on our last night. We will definitely go back and i would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to family and friends. thank you for a memorable 50th birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff - definetely worth staying at!”
Reviews.Author: Elena200981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in November 2009 for 3 nights. I have spent a lot of time searching for the hotel we would like and feel comfortable at. This boutique hotel is just what we wanted. Located in the very center, just steps from the Champs Elysees and close to all other sightseeings, we walked to almost everywhere! Staff was very helpful and nice, room was beautiful and cozy (we stayed in the executive room), brakfast - delicious, services - at the highest level. Since is was our wedding anniversary we had a romantic welcome with rose petals on the bed and champagne - great start for a Paris experience. And even when we were hopelessly late for the airport for our flight back home (our own fault - we have messed up with the departure time), the concierge (unofrtunately do not know his name - but he is our hero now) would not let us panic: called the taxi which arrived in less than 5 minutes, checked us online for our flight while we have waited and only thanks to that we were able to catch our flight back home! Encroyable! The taxi driver made it to the airport in less than 30 minutes without much speeding and breaking traffic rules. the trip was an unforgettable experience and we were sad to leave. Definetely will be coming back with friends and children.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kefl
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and my husband let me be in charge of booking our hotel. Since this was a trip to celebrate his retirement and our anniversary, I was very worried about choosing the right boutique hotel. We were very happy with our stay. The concierge was very informative and made excellent restaurant recommendations. We were interested in authentic dining experiences with great food. His recommendations were perfect. The rooms were very nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. I would agree with other reviewers that the variability of water temperature in the shower was a problem but overall didn't detract from the experience. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but I was hoping for it to be better”
Reviews.Author: Granite_Stater
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Hotel Francois 1er. I travelled with my wife and another couple. All in all, I liked the hotel, some aspects very much so, but there were a few downsides and I wasn't quite as happy with it all as I had hoped. Here are the highlights and lowlights: * The room. We had an Executive Room. The furnishings were lovely - great colors, comfortable bed, elegant furniture. It's not an especially large room, but few in Paris are and the size was perfectly comfortable for the two of us. All in all, we really liked the room. Our friends booked a suite, and I would say it was definitely not worth the extra money. It was larger overall, with a sitting area, but still not very big, and for most folks visiting Paris, who really needs that when you are spending most of the day and evening out on the town. For an extra $300/night, splurge on food, wine, or other activities and stick with the Executive Room. * Quiet and convenient location. A nice quiet street, but only a block from the Champs Elysee, Ave George V, and the metro. I love the Arc, so appreciated being close and getting a great view of it every morning and evening. We had a room facing the interior courtyard, and so had no street noise whatsoever despite being on the 2nd floor. Note: on our last day they were starting construction across the street - ask if that is still going on, and if so ask for an interior room. * Nice to have a small bar on the lobby level, though I never saw anyone there so it felt a little dead. We weren't looking for a lot of noise or action, but having a few people around would have added some life. Limited selection of beers and wines. * The breakfast room in the basement is very cozy, comfortable, and convenient. The breakfast was good enough, certainly plenty of food, though costly. The basket of pastries was decent, and we loved the yogurts and cheeses, but the microwave eggs and potatoes at the buffet bar left something to be desired. * Most of the staff were friendly and helpful, but I have to say that we found the concierges to be highly lacking. Before the trip, I sent the concierge an e-mail asking for advice on restaurants (I offered names of a few places I had heard about and wanted his impressions), asked for advice on transport from the airport to the hotel, and a couple of other small questions. Got no response for three days, and had to follow up with two more e-mails. Finally got a response, which was that he booked us three reservations (for the wrong number of people), didn't give any feedback on the restaurant names I asked about, and didn't provide any advice on airport transportation. I had to send yet another e-mail asking him to please respond to the questions that I had actually asked, which finally prompted some useful feedback. My second gripe with the concierge was that their restaurant recommendations were seriously lame. They suggested places that were HIGHLY touristy with average food (we had Zagats and Michelin guides), and only within about an 8-block radius. Nothing great, nothing especially interesting, nothing that we wanted to go to. If there is one thing that concierges in Paris should be knowledgeable about, it's restaurants. And, finally, in general I found the concierges made me feel like I was bothering them when I asked for assistance. They always were willing to help, but just gave off the vibe that it was a hassle. For a hotel of this level, I'd expect a concierge who knows what they are talking about and is ready to serve. They could do a lot better. As noted, other staff were professional and very pleasant. * Shower water heat was highly variable, and often went from very warm to very cool and then back again. Not exactly what you'd expect at a hotel of this caliber. * There is a yoga studio right next door, if you are into that sort of thing, * Free WiFi in the lobby, but a relatively weak signal so hard to use the internet because it ran very slowly. You must pay for Wi Fi in your room. Would I recommend it to a friend - I guess so, but with reservations. Would I stay there again - probably not. It was good overall, but I'd aim for something with better service and a little more life to it.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!! This hotel is a jewel.”
Reviews.Author: Kikithejetsetter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Paris for 3 days. It was our first time in the city of lights. The hotel manager was so gracious and accommodating to our needs. Very hospital staff. I welcome anyone to go to this beautiful boutique style hotel. The proximity to all the attractions is just walking distance. The Eiffel Tower, the Champs Elysees, George V. and the Seine. The metro was only a few blocks away too. Paris took my breath away.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: markyboy2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Francois earlier this year with my partner for her birthday and I was delighted with this small boutique hotel. the room was beautiful and cosy, the location is perfect for short walks to the champs elysee.we woke up late one day we were there, but the staff were great and extended the breakfast service for extra time so that we could eat. the staff were very friendly, and even though we didn't arrive til very late on the first day (around 11pm) the concierge were very welcoming and helpful. perfect for a romantic weekend break, and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and romantic”
Reviews.Author: giladltd
Reviews.Content: It is the most wanderful hotel to be in when in Paris. It is like the home you would dream about living in. every thing is decorated to perfection but in a way that do not intimidate the visitor. The breakfast is a dream. The bed is like a cloud to rest inside after a long day of sightseeing. and if you would like a recomendation about a restaurant Souffien the clerk from the reception will help you with patience and dedication. we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary hideaway near the Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: doepug
Reviews.Content: We got an incredible deal on a week-long stay at the Hotel Francois 1er and couldn't be happier with the value we received. The pros: 1. Location. 2 minutes from Champs Elysees and metro stop George V. 5 minutes from the Arc. 7-8 minutes from the Seine. Quiet residential neighborhood. 2. Staff. We had outstanding service from everyone at the hotel -- from the front desk to the doormen to the wait staff for breakfast and the hotel bar. We were often greeted by name and no request was too much trouble for them. 3. Classy. This is a gorgeous hotel -- beautiful rooms, very well appointed and maintained. We were fortunate enough to have an upgrade during our stay, which was very much appreciated. The cons: 1. No inexpensive breakfast options nearby. Go for the hotel buffet downstairs, or to another neighborhood -- you won't find anything reasonable within walking distance. That being said, the hotel gave us a discount on breakfast when we asked. 2. Our stay was too short. We had a fantastic experience at the Francois 1er and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: shelv04
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Sept. Rooms were clean (smaller than US Hotels but I would not call them tiny) and the hotel itself clean as well. Staff was fantastic with good recommendations. Location is great, we walked to Champ Elysses and Eiffel Tower. Plenty of restaurants and bars. If you are looking for a safe, clean hotes near to Champ Elyssess this is a good bargain. Would certainly recommend. Breakfast was very good though it may or may not be included in your booking.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and friendly staff - pity about the bed”
Reviews.Author: ConCan00
Reviews.Content: Just back from Paris for a special trip to celebrate my wife's 40th. Hotel is beautifully decorated and staff are very friendly and helpful. I would have given 5 stars but for the room. I had paid extra for an executive room which was supposed to come with a King's sized bed. However, it was two singles pushed together!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But . . .”
Reviews.Author: GSPTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six nights at the Francois 1er in September 2009. We enjoyed our stay however we will probably consider other hotels on future visits to Paris. First the positive aspects of our stay - 1. Location: The hotel's location cannot be beat. It is only a few steps from the Champs-Elysees and the George V metro stop which made getting around in the city very easy. There are plenty of dinining options within waling distance of the hotel. In additon, the Arc de Triomphe is a short 5-10 minute walk away. 2. Service: The hotel's staff (particularly the dining room staff) is great and went out of their way to be of service. Whether it was providing directions to area sites or answering general questions about Paris the hotel staff was a pleasure to deal with and always helpful. 3. Breakfast: The hotel had a terrific breakfast each morning. The selection and quality was outstanding and was a great way to start the day. Now for the down side to our stay: 1. We stayed in room 502. While the room was nicely decorated and furnished we experienced several problems. First, the water in the shower routinely alternated between very hot and very cold each day. At first we thought this may have been a fluke with many people using the showers in the hotel at the same time. After it happened every day and at varying times during the day we realized it was a problem. While it was not a huge deal it was very inconvenient and should not have been an issue in a hotel such as the Francois 1er. 2. The walls in the hotel room are very thin - so much so that we were awakened four out of six nights by noise coming from the guests in the adjacent rooms. While I understand you cannot eliminate all noises we were able to hear every word of conversations (and one heated argument) happening next door. For this reason it was difficult to get a good night sleep on most nights during our stay. After doing a tremendous amount of sight seeing (and walking) we truly valued a good night of sleep. Unfortunately, we were not able to get much during our stay. For these reasons we will probably consider staying at another hotel the next time we are in Paris. If, however, the hotel could remedy the hot/cold water issue and provide some better sound insullation between the rooms we would be thrilled to return.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best value in Paris in its' price range”
Reviews.Author: tampaboy9
Reviews.Content: While some don't attach much importance to a hotel past a place to sleep a few hours each night, others consider the hotel part of the vacation experience and they enjoy having an attractive room, a good staff, a good location, a good buffet breakfast and other amenities which make their stay memorable. My wife and I are members of the latter group. Yes, these hotels cost a little more, but you get what you pay for. We spent 6 nights at the Francois 1er the last week in August, 2009, and agree with the huge majority of guests who rated the hotel excellent or very good. We booked an executive room which was comparable in size to a standard room in a typical hotel in the USA owned by a big hotel chain. (But large by usual Paris measurements) The hotel is located in a safe, clean, and quiet area. It is just steps to Avenue George V which intersects the Champs des Elysees around 200 or so meters away. It is about 100 meters away to the nearest Bus stop on Avenue Marceau. We found the Bus a good way to get around while viewing beautiful scenery along way, which is not seen on the RER or the Metro. You can buy single ride tickets from the bus driver for about 1.3 Euros each. The nearest Metro stop is The George V located on the Champ des Elysees at the corner of Bassano. Cash machines are in all directions from the hotel a short walk away. Housekeeping at the hotel is immaculate. The restrooms next to the little public bar are spotless and have a fresh soft terry cloth hand towel for each comer. Sure beats the tiny paper towels seen elsewhere. When we returned to our room in the afternoon the maids always had everything straightened up, and the marble bath was shining like a diamond. They cheerfully brought more towels when requested. Breakfast at the cozy little dining room was one of the daily high points of our stay. The buffet which was included with the room when we booked at GTAhotels.com was delightful. Beautifully displayed were many types of delicious cheeses, meats such as ham, Canadian bacon, and smoked sausages, a dozen or so types of bread, rolls and pastries, fresh fruit salad, fresh apples, oranges, cereals like corn flakes and others, fresh squeezed fruit juices, boiled and scrambled eggs, and more offerings that I don’t remember offhand. And it was all delicious. Now the staff. They were always smiling, polite, and helpful. One example is when we arrived in the early morning from a long overnight flight from the USA like most do. Normal check in time is after 1:00 PM, and they would have been well within their rights to politely tell us to come back several hours later. But they didn’t. Our room wasn’t ready so they offered to move us into an alternate room which was ready, and they would move us the next day to our designated room. Since we needed a nap and a little cleaning up we accepted their offer willingly. We felt like we had been delivered. Other examples were when they made phone calls to locate a couple of places we wanted to go. This is a first class hotel just a step down from the half a dozen or so luxurious palace level hotels in Paris such as the Crillon, Four Seasons, Athenee, Ritz, Meurice, Bristol and one or two more, priced at twice as much or more than the Francois 1er.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine hospitality and perfect accommodation”
Reviews.Author: magvictoria
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at this lovely property as a 'rehearsal' before the anniversary trip to Paris in September with my husband. I was in Paris in early August just by chance with my friend and was happy to get a great deal for Francois 1er. So now I am sure - that is the perfect place for romantic trip stay in Paris!! I enjoyed absolutely EVERYTHING though I travel much and being a very picky traveller. Location is great - you are in the center of everything and you can sleep peacefully in the night as the hotel is in the quiet street. Our standart (classic) room was small but furnished with an exclusive and elegant taste and high level of comfort. The minibar is rather rich and reasonable. The bathroom and toiletteries were lovely as well. I can double all good reviews about the breakfast. The atmosphere in the hotel is very cosy and warm, I felt like a dear guest. All the staff are so friendly and helpful.....and here I really felt the genuine hospitality which is not easily found nowdays in such a touristic city as Paris. I am looking forward to returning to Francois 1er soon! Compliments to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “A charming small Paris hotel that welcomes the tired traveler with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethG46
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Francois prides itself on good service. The staff is very friendly and spoke excellent English. They were helpful with resturant recommendations, tours of the city, directions on how to use the Metro system and directtions to anywhere in Paris. This is particularly helpful when it is your first visit to Paris. Our room was on the top (6th) floor and overlooked a small green garden below. It was quite comfortable with lovely bed linens and deluxe pillows and a beautiflly appointed bathroom. It was not a disappointment to our expectations after viewing their website. We particularly enjoyed the small bar and sitting room where you could enjoy a glass of wine or cold beer after a long day of sightseeing. The breakfast room was a delight and the continental breakfast delicious. Ahhhh...the French know how to make a good cup of coffee. If you enjoy staying at small, charming hotels then this is for you. It is located on a quiet side street in an excellent area of Paris. It is several blocks to the Champs Eleysee and some great shopping. The Louvre is also within walking distance as are many other areas that are fun to explore. We also found wonderful resturants within walking distance. There is a Metro stop close by and also a stop for the double-decker tour bus which is a good idea for the first visit to Paris. We enjoyed everything about this hotel and would be happy to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: bits-and-peaches
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Francois for 4 nights based on the many wonderful reviews on T.A. and were happy we did. We booked an executive room facing the street but after the first night found that we would have prefered facing the courtyard, as it was late May and always open windows whenever possible. My husband asked the gentleman at the desk the next morning if another room was available and without a moments hesitation he said he would take care of it and switch us to another room. Not only was every person at the reception desk extremely friendly and helpful during our stay, but the staff in the restaurant were wonderful too. We enjoyed an extraordinary breakfast buffet every morning and Ahn (I hope I am spelling it correctly) as well as Tan (both delightful ladies) were such a joy to see each morning where they served us. Ahn even made a wonderful tomatoe dish a second day when I told her how much I enjoyed it! That's service! As noted in reviews, the location is excellent....we have always stayed at the Hyatt/Madeline but decided to try Francois and found it to be more convenient, and a more welcoming and friendly hotel. Rooms were immaculate and the service outstanding. We would definitely recommend this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute joy”
Reviews.Author: mandlWoking
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel. The staff cannot do enough for you, they are all very courteous, kind enough to speak to you in English if required and represent the hotel very well indeed. The consierge are very helpful and their recommendations for restaurants to eat for dinner were spot on. The room, a standard room , was very well appointed, clean, very comfortable, with delightful decor and suited us very well indeed. The location of the hotel, is quiet considering its central location and in terms of the main sights to see, is very convenient. Would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, couldn't fault it.”
Reviews.Author: speedy_chick56
Reviews.Content: Although arriving a few hours before check-in we were seated in the lounge area and offered a complementary drink. After a long journey by train and a rather packed first experience of the Paris underground it was very much appreciated. Our room was on the first floor (106), it was not as big as the rooms shown on the website but this did not detract from the elegant decor and furnishings. There was plenty of wardrobe and drawer space for our clothes, and although only staying for 3 nights I don't exactly pack light. The bathroom was really lovely and fully equipped. I didn't use the hairdryer or other toiletries but would definitely come in handy if I'd forgotten anything. We travelled by Eurostar and on arrival at the Gard Du Nord we found it very easy to navigate through the underground system as they have a help desk. I'd heard from another trip advisor reviewer the hotel was not far from the Luis Vuitton store. As you come up from the underground and onto the Champs Elysees you can't miss it. Breakfast at the Francois is such a treat. I love the fact that he hotel is so small, the breakfast restaurant was like eating in a very large dining room. The variety of food was very good, and I'm certain it would satisfy even the fussiest of eaters. Fortunately for me I don't fall into this category so I was spoilt for choice. The coffee was the best I've had at a restaurant and was a great start to my day. Although the underground is a highly recommended method to get about Paris we felt that we'd quite like to amble around and take in all the sights from above ground level and we're so glad we did. The hotel is very central to most of the places we wished to visit. The only downside would be the lack of supermarkets or stores near the hotel. This meant that we were forced to drinking from the minibar which is probably reasonably priced for the area but with the sterling - euro excahnge rate being so low felt a little overpriced. On our last evening in Paris we passed a few restaurants not far from the hotel such as Le Relais de l'Entrecote on Rue Marbeuf (where there was an actual queue forming down the street and Chez Andre (which looked quite busy). Then there was this beautifully quaint restaurant La Fermette Marbeuf again on the same street Rue Marbeuf. As it was a warm evening we chose a table outside. We ate from the 32 euro set menu and has tomato tartin, sirloin steak with bernaise sauce and a selection of mature cheese. To drink we ordered a bottle of Sancerre at 46 euros and large bottle of still water and a bottle of bierre and I believe the total bill came to about 126 euros. They also offered a taster menu of 6courses which cost about 55 euros which looked very good value for money. I would definitely recommend this restaurant. We were given plenty of time between courses and we were not rushed at all. You can even see the Eiffel Tower from some of the seating outside which at 11pm sparkles like a christmas tree, very romantic. Only after we came home did we realise that the inside of this restaurant is what most people recommend you see for the art deco original features. Although I'm a little disappointed I did not get to see the inside of the restaurant I am happy with our overall experience. The waiters were very friendly and very professional and not at all rude which is what I had expected in Paris but I was pleasantly surprised. On our last day we checked out of the hotel at 11am and left our luggage with the hotel to look after and arrived back at 5pm and the receptionist booked a taxi to the station. This a much more pleasant experience than the hustle and bustle of the tube with lots of luggage on our way to the hotel. We were told the taxi would cost 10-12 euros but actually cost 17 euros. The staff at the Francois 1er are very professional and very courteous and we both said we would love to return to Paris again someday and would have no doubts as to where to stay. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Confortable”
Reviews.Author: Sawasdee12
Reviews.Content: I usually stay /prefer the left bank, much more lively and funner and I still do !
