This area is too residential and full of offices and rather souless blocks with nothing happening but I needed to be in this area on this visit and enjoyed the quiteness of the hotel and the real comfort of the room and bed in particular, the breakfast buffet was extensive and delicious with all sorts of hot and cold choices, no point in wandering around looking for a cafe as there are none on the Rue Magellan ! Hotel is around the corner from the Champs Elysees if you have not seen that avenue before ! If you are a tourist I recommend a hotel in or near the Rue du Bac in the Latin Quarter, try booking.com for a good rate on this hotel and you will be real pleased overall, ps the hotel is a member of the Summit hotel group which has a number of smaller boutique hotels world wide.

Reviews.Title: “High standard”
Reviews.Author: IanrJones10
Reviews.Content: Lovely, comfortable hotel. Superb and helpful staff. Excellent location. Spotlessly clean. Ideal for a Paris city break. I can also recommend MUST Limousines who transferred us from and to the Gare du Nord. We booked the transfers on-line. For lunch and dinner we can recommend Chez Francis and Cafe Corona in the Place d'Alma (just 10 minutes walk from the hotel along the Avenue George V). For a special romantic dinner we can recommend the Italian restaurant Findi on Avenue George V. Cant stress enough how friendly, helpful and welcoming the staff in these restaurants were.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: RWOELFEL82
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our recent stay at the Hotel Francois. The staff was lovely and we were pleasantly surprised with the quaint touches around the hotel. The rooms were quite nice and you can't beat the convenient location. We look forward to coming back to this hotel next year!

Reviews.Title: “A home from home”
Reviews.Author: boys47
Reviews.Content: What a marvellous hotel, a hotel were everyone knows your name. The knowledgeable concierge, the divine and charming Thomas and Ahn in the breakfast room all of them and the other staff that we encountered could not have been more helpful nor the service any better. This is a find, beautiful public rooms, smallish elegant bedrooms but with every need catered for. Great toiletries even bath crystals! Lots of cushions and pillows, very comfortable beds and a great location between Avenue George V and Champs Elysee. Thank you to you all for a great 4 days in stunning (but expensive) Paris. The Boyds

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: stevie1
Reviews.Content: Can't fault the hotel, and have stayed in a few in Paris. Great and convenient location, far enough from the Champs Elysées to be quiet, close enough to walk there & to Metro. Staff courteous and helpful, booked restaurant tables for us when requested (my French is a bit wobbly). Rooms comfortable, spacious (even in Paris standards) and clean.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: daylily44
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our first trip to Paris based on the location, the good reviews on Trip Advisor, and the value. We were not disappointed in any respect. The hotel is lovely--clean, spacious, and attractive in a faux-country-house sort of way. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the room (a superior double) had more than enough space to move around in, as well as very good storage, enabling us to unpack fully. The bathroom was particularly attractive and well-equipped. We were also very, very appreciative of the concierge's willingness to help us. We decided to come to Paris a day earlier than planned, and though the Francois 1er was booked, the concierge booked us into the "sister" property around corner. Everything went very smoothly, and that property, the Hotel Kepler, is freshly renovated and just beautiful. I would recommend either hotel without hesitation if you want to stay just off the Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: princess239
Reviews.Content: me and my husband went to france for a week to celebrate our wedding anniversary. we booked this hotel because of the good reviews from trip advisor and we were not disappointed. the hotel was elegant, nice design and in an excellent location, just next to champ elysees and close to around three metro stations.. the room (standard) was very parisian and the size was fine, especially compared to others in paris. very clean. the staff were extremely helpful- they gave us an adaptor to borow for our mobiles for free (note that the other hotels in paris charged us for this), and were generally good on giving advice, on directions, shops and so on. the breakfast was excellent; much better than the other hotels we stayed in (including the meridien). there was loads of choice, and i would certainly recommend having breakfast at least once here. a special mention should go to the doorman, an asian guy who i cannot remember the name of, but he was great! overall i would highly recommend this hotel for a true taste of french hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply the best hotel we 've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: IsleofWightPotts
Reviews.Content: The last time we visited Paris was 25 years ago on our honeymoon so in order to mark our silver wedding we wanted to do it in a special way. After arriving in style by Orient Express we were hoping our choice of hotel wouldn't let us down. It certainly didn't, it was perfect. I don't know where to start, it was close to the Champes Elysee but still peaceful at night. The decor was beautifully stylish with lovely attention to detail such as the red roses in the entrance hall. It was well maintained with an army of people to keep it clean. We approved of the motion sensitive lights to conserve energy. Breakfast was super. Most of all the staff at Francois 1 er were excellent, friendly and helpful without being intrusive. We took the advice of a previous reviewer and asked for a restaurant recommendation, we were given two. The one we chose was wonderful, a real taste of France at it's best, thank you Francois 1 er. We definitely won't be waiting another 25 years before returning. Despite the euro making everything expensive, we would say it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: cultglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: We stayed five days in the François le 1er, the only thing we regret is that the stay was too short. The hotel has a classical French style and its location is excellent, very close to Avenue Georges V and the Champs Elysees. The room (superior ) was ample enough and the bathroom good equipped. The only drawback was a constant running water sound that could be heard in the bathroom but not in the room, when bathroom door was closed. Breakfast was very good and included in our package, though we do not manage to eat much early in the morning. Summing up we think François 1er is one of the best options, within its price range, for the region.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Sic-transit
Reviews.Content: After much deliberation on Tripadvisor I chose this hotel very carefully for a week's stay in Paris in early January and it really is a superb little place. We had a standard room which was very clean and tastefully decorated and furnished athough a little more storage would have been welcome. The bed was extremely comfortable and it was peaceful during the night despite being very close to the Champs Elysees. We got an excellent deal via Alpharooms, thankfully booked six months prior to the trip when the exchange rate was better. The week we went to Paris there was virtually parity between the pound and the euro so you can imagine just how expensive everything had become. We found all the staff at Francois 1er that we encountered to be extremely helpful, polite and friendly and the service could not be faulted. Nothing was too much trouble for them. If you've got a trip coming up and are tempted by this little gem of a hotel then go for it. Needless to say, I'd love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at Francois 1”
Reviews.Author: talkative
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over Christmas 2008 & had a very nice time. We had a suite & got it at a very good rate ie less than 50% of the rack rate. It was huge, attractively decorated & very comfortable room. Housekeeping was excellent. The breakfasts were good. Staff were charming & helpful. The bar is lovely & comfortable. Very little to complain about - if you like the Champs Elysee area this hotel will be perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: berkshire_nomads
Reviews.Content: I can't speak for value for money here as I don't know what the room cost. I ended up here by accident as my reservation at the nearby Kepler fell through when I arrived yesterday due to a guest refusing to vacate the room after his / her flight out had been cancelled as a result of an Air France strike. I was initially furious that the Kepler had moved me rather than the inculmbent, but reading between the lines he / she had refused to move and I guess physical ejection is probably not a viable option. At least not in the 16th. A porter carried my bag the few few hundred metres to the Francois 1er, and I was given a suite on the 1st floor. Now the Kepler is great, but I have to say my disappointment disappeared when I saw the alternative in Francois 1er. It was a proper suite, with a door between the bedroom and sitting room; not just a large room with a sofa at one end. The whole place is beautifully decorated in an up to date classical / trendy style - cream woodwork, two - tone beige wallpaper, beige / black marble bathroom. Every available vertical surface seems to be covered with rows of fake books (even in the lift), which is a bit OTT, but that's a small point. All newish an in good nick, but with just a hint of shabbiness to stop it feeling too artificial. No idea of the cost, but if the rooms are the same value as the breakfast (13€) it should be a great option. Location is good, 5 mins from the Arc de Triomphe, but in a very quiet street. In fairness to the Kepler they fetched my bag this morning, I'm writing this in an even bigger suite on their top floor, and they even threw in a chocolate Eifel Tower !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique!!”
Reviews.Author: AOBC
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is a gem in a city of beauty. A three day weekend with breakfast served until 11 and so quiet that we almost missed it!! and yet, so close to the Champs Elysee that high heels are no impediment to strutting your stuff!! The rooms are small yes, but beautifully and cleverly appointed so that you feel comfortably at home. The breakfast is served to classical music by the charming staff and is typically french, with beautiful pastries, fruits, meats and cheeses as well as eggs and bacon for those who want it. The front desk staff were unobtrusively helpful and the small bar is an oasis in a busy city. We loved the Francois 1 and would love to go back in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: ffellah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel June 8 to June 14, 2008. We found the hotel to be excellent in all respects. Absolutely great location, next to Champs Elysee, metro and all, but still very private and quiet. Very nice, tastefully decorated common areas such as lobby, sitting areas, fabulous breakfast room. Free wireless internet in the lobby, not particularly fast, but worked. If you want faster, in-room internet, wired or wireless, it is available at additional charge from a third party provider. The breakfast in the morning was outstanding, we never wanted to leave.....Room decor was very nice, good A/C system, very nice bathroom with marble floor, well decorated. Everything worked well in the room. Small flat panel TV, many international channels, CNN Europe version etc. The staff was very friendly and helpful, made several calls on our behalf to restaurants and museums, shuttle service. I loved the small size of the hotel (40 rooms); makes you feel more at home away from home than in a "hotel". The room we were in was not large: if you are looking for a large room, this may not be the place....Overall, it was a wonderful stay, I would go back there in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous romantic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scoffit
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful little hotel in a great location just off the Champs Elysees. The staff are all lovely, the decor is very chic but traditional, and the rooms are compact but extremely comfortable. My husband and I stayed here for our first anniversary and it was just perfect. It's in a very stylish part of the city with designer shops and trendy bars and restaurants nearby. It's really close to the Metro, but because it's on a little side street it's very quiet. I love the individual styling of the rooms - so much more welcoming and cosy than some boring chain hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but especially those looking for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lizholland33
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a travel agents, and didn't really have much time to read the reviews before booking. When I did I thought I had made a good choice! I was booking for a group of ten girls on a hen weekend, and the hotel gave us two executive rooms and three standard rooms for the same price, which was nice. The hotel is very easy to find, our land mark was Louis Vuitton! On arrival the reception staff were so helpful, helping a large group to check in and asking about our journey. One of my friends wanted to change rooms and this was done without fuss, so we could be next door to one another. This hotel has a great location and we could walk along Champs Elysee and to Arc and the Louvre (about a 30 minute stroll). The metro stop is just a few minutes walk away too, so no problems getting around Paris. I visited three different rooms in the hotel where my friends were staying and they were all lovely. Gorgeous bathrooms with toiletries and bath robes included. Plenty of space in rooms to hang clothes etc. The beds are so comfortable and big, and on the last night three of us slept in one with no problems at all! The staff here are lovely and so helpful, booking us taxis, and gioving reccomendations for restaurants and clubs to go to. They were happy to take photographs of the whole group too! Breakfast is served from 7 til 11am which is great if you had a late night! The room is nice and a huge selection of food including cereal, fresh fruit, yoghurt, chesse, cold meats, breads and pastries and yummy tea and coffee! All ten of us had a fabulous stay at this hotel and would definitely go back again. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “francois 1er”
Reviews.Author: JONOVO
Reviews.Content: Great location. 3 short blocks from George V metro stop and Champs. Clean hotel. Breakfast is adequate. Staff was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely French Ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: relpaige
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a top pick with the Air France Package we booked. We were not disappointed. This trip was an 18th birthday/graduation gift for my daughter and she wanted a "French" feeling in everything we did. The hotel was beautifully decorated, flowers everywhere, very comfortable and clean, superb location, though very expensive too. One block to Champs Elysees, 5 minute walk to the Arch. The gentlemen at the front desk were very helpful, pleasant and always available to us, though we did have a problem with our room safe that was never corrected. We would definitely be thrilled to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “hotel exquis!”
Reviews.Author: AntwerpSippi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best hotels in Paris, situated in a very quiet street, next to the designers and Champs Elysées. The rooms are splendid and very beautiful decorated. Also the lobby and living room are with very good taste decorated. It makes you feel at home. The breakfast-room (with good buffet!) is downstairs but also very tastefull! The staff is very helpfull. We come back to this hotel! What a beautiful souvenir!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel But Overprised”
Reviews.Author: anaDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel few days ago for only one night but we were glad it was only that night. The room was very small and the bed also, we are not very tall people but our legs were over the bed, the room very hot and for 4 star hotel |(300 euro) per night totally not worth it. We stayed the other night in a hotel called Bellechase and it was much much better. I would never stay in this hotel twice. The location is good, yes and the staff is pleasent but for there are much better hotels for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Phil&Sarah
Reviews.Content: I'd previously booked a similar standard of hotel, but went online about four days before our break and found a great last minute deal for the Francois 1er. As the reviews on TA were so favourable, I booked it and saved myself £200 compared to the other place I'd booked. It turned out to be a great decision - the hotel was excellent, in a quiet street yet only a stones throw from the Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe. The decor throughout the place is classy, the rooms tasteful and the service was excellent throughout our four night stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The deal I got was on hoteldirect.co.uk. Worth a look!

Reviews.Title: “Everthing that Glitters is not Gold!”
Reviews.Author: miztravel
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room and excellent location to tour sites/buses. Outstanding breakfast buffet. Main recommendation: Use hotel safe! On my last day a specially calculated inside plot was carried out by the staff when someone entered my room and as a result one credit card and my driver's license was taken out of wallet from my purse. Manager's comments to Go-Today.com was he was sorry I lost my wallet. He told Go-Today.com he would contact me directly after his vacation. Go-today.com said they would also follow up with me and the hotel. Well it has been almost one year and I have not heard from either the group. The wallet was not lost when specific items where removed while I was downstairs (basement area) eating breakfast. Because my entire wallet was not taken I did not realize the missing items until I was at an airport concession stand. Sorry to say that the only people who had access to the room was staff. Also because the hotel is small they can easily track your every move - when you leave and return to the room. Please feel free to contact me via email if you need more detailed information about the events that follow.

Reviews.Title: “Loved breakfast”
Reviews.Author: yfranken
Reviews.Content: Small, intimate and luxurious hotel with friendly and accurate service. We especially enjoyed the breakfast service, although it unfortunately was not included in the price. The hotel is not cheap by all means, but is worth the money. The entire district around it is rather posh. The breakfast personnel is not French but Cambodian and Vietnamese, which certainly is not a negative thing, they are VERY friendly and accurate. We had a nice experience with staff member Anh, but also with her collegues. Compare this to some other high class places in the city (for instance the Opera district), and you will agree.

Reviews.Title: “Decadence”
Reviews.Author: ScoutManchester
Reviews.Content: This hotel was hard to find initially but then when we wandered in the right direction I couldn't believe how close to the Champs Elysses we actually were! It's a gorgeous hotel, the rooms are tiny but that's Paris! The staff were lovely and the bar was more like being in someone's (very posh) living room. Beautiful place, very swanky but didn't feel we had to put on our airs and graces at all! No pretence just gorgeousness! Plus we got three nights for the price of two!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Francois 1er
HotelInfo.Address: 7, rue de Magellan | 08 Arr., 75008 Paris, France
